bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jessie Daniel Ames, November 7, 1952

div1.p: Hench informs Ames that Camp Lazear will be dedicated in December 1952.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jessie Daniel Ames, November 7, 1952
div1.opener:
November 7, 1952
Mrs. Jessie Daniel Ames
Wrena Nest
Tryon, North Carolina
My dear Mrs. Ames:
div1.p:
As you know, I have been for years trying to interest the Cuban Government
in the preservation of Camp Lazear. Suddenly, this summer they decided to
do something about it (after years of stalling and fals starts). They are
making the place into a little park and so on. I have had much correspon-
dence with them this summer.

Two or three things disturb me. I think they are going to rename Camp
Lazear and call it “Parque Finlay”. I have frequently and diplomatically
protested and I have asked various friends in Havana to do what they can
about it but I suspect that any efforts along that line are in vain.

However all the Americans concerned will be duly honored. I was asked to
suggest various names for plaques and tablets and suggested that a few
names besides those who actually volunteered be placed on a tablet as an
honor to those who cooperated in a very special way. I am delighted to
hear that they have decided to do this and that the names of General Kean,
General Sternberg, Doctor Ames, the lady nurse, Miss Warner; the male
nurse, Mr. Lambert, and General Truby will be on that list. The dedica-
tion is to be December 3 at Havana. I hope to fly there and hope to
take enough photographs so that on my return I can share them with you.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
